remarks: The powerclass of an infinite set is an infinite set, and vice-versa. Here ` B ` is a class which is closed under both the union and the powerclass operations and which may have infinite sets as members. (Contributed by RP, 21-Mar-2020.)
statement:
pwinfig $p |- ( A. x e. B ( U. x e. B /\ ~P x e. B ) -> ( A e. ( B \ Fin ) <-> ~P A e. ( B \ Fin ) ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B x $.
